suppress_stdout[source]

suppress_stdout()

Temporarily Suppress Console Output in Python src: http://thesmithfam.org/blog/2012/10/25/temporarily-suppress-console-output-in-python/

Example¶

print("Now you see it") with suppress_stdout(): print("Now you don't")

Now you see it

Temporarily Suppress Console Output in Python.

print("Now you see it")
with suppress_stdout():
    print("Now you don't")

Now you see it

@contextmanager
def timing(description: str = 'Time') -> None:
    try:
        start = time()
        yield 
    finally:
        ellapsed_time = time() - start
        print(f'{description}: {ellapsed_time}')

with timing():
    _ = [1+1 for _ in range(10**5)]

Time: 0.007105588912963867

def browse_images(paths):
    def view_image(image_path):
        display(Image(image_path))
    return wgt.interact(view_image, image_path=paths)

paths = [
    'https://via.placeholder.com/350x150.png',
    'https://via.placeholder.com/150.png'
]
browse_images(paths);
